artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Shimizuya Naojirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: portrait of a wide-eyed woman with a yellow comb in her hair, wearing a grey, white and black striped kimono, with red and yellow plaid at PL sleeve; snowy landscape behind woman, with bridge over calm water, trees and buildings; cartouche with red ground with text surrounded by various objects in URC
markings: date seal: ne jū 子十 (Rat 10); censor seals: Fuku 福, Muramatsu 村松; publisher\'s seal: Yama kiyo; Carver: 彫夛吉 {Hori Takichi}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Sixty-nine Stations along the Kiso Highway (Kiso rokujūkyū tsugi 木曽六十九驛)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: The Historical Site of the Pontoon Bridge of Sano at Kuragano Styation: (Actor Iwai Tojaku I as) Dote no Oroku
